review.title: Generalized Interval-valued OWA Operators with Interval Weights Derived from Interval-valued Overlap Functions
review.abstract: In this work we extend to the interval-valued setting the notion of an overlap functions and we discuss a method which makes use of interval-valued overlap functions for constructing OWA operators with interval-valued weights. . Some properties of interval-valued overlap functions and the derived interval-valued OWA operators are analysed. We specially focus on the homogeneity and migrativity properties.

sections.heading: 5 Conclusions and future research
sections.text: We have presented a study on interval-evaluated overlap functions, showing the conditions for ensuring their representability and discussing the important properties of migration and homogeneity; we have introduced the concept of semi-o-representability; we have also discussed a method to build interval-evaluated OWA operators when considering interval-evaluated weight vectors; as a further work, we will examine ordinals and additive generators of interval-evaluated overlap functions, in line with what has been done in [25, 27] and aiming at practical applications; and we will examine how homogeneous interval-evaluated aggregation functions can be characterized.

metadata.abstractText: In this work we extend to the interval-valued setting the notion of an overlap functions and we discuss a method which makes use of interval-valued overlap functions for constructing OWA operators with interval-valued weights. . Some properties of intervalvalued overlap functions and the derived interval-valued OWA operators are analysed. We specially focus on the homogeneity and migrativity properties.
